author: Special Correspondent
text:
A total of 1,808 persons were booked for ticketless travel in the Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation buses in the districts of Salem, Krishnagiri, Dharmapuri and Namakkal in the Salem region during the month of December.

A fine of Rs. 2.44 lakhs was slapped on them and collected, an official press release of the TNSTC issued here said.

RPF conducts surprise check

The Railway Protection Force personnel booked 13 persons for causing nuisance to the commuters in the running trains and in the railway stations.

A police party conducted surprise check in the Salem Railway Junction and booked 13 persons for selling eatables etc without proper licence and indulging in activities like begging which caused nuisance to the travelling public.
title: TNSTC drive against ticketless travel
